website_summaries.verdict: An elegant, high-quality fillet knife that holds its edge well and can last you for decades.
pros: Thin, flexible stainless-steel blade with nonstick coating
Arrives sharp out of the box
cons: Some users say it's a challenge to sharpen this knife

customer_reviews.title: Dull right out of the packaging
customer_reviews.text: My knife, which says made in Estonia, is so dull, right out of the packaging, I can drag my thumb down the blade, pressing downward against the blade, without cutting my thumb. I think this knife must have skipped the sharpening except that the teflon coating was slightly removed near the "cutting" edge. They did something to it but sharpen it wasn't one of the things they did. Shame because I really like the look of it and the flexibility of the blade. If it had come with a sharpener I would sharpen it and try it but as it is I'm just going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: tex customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect flex. Liked the 4" so much I ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect flex. Liked the 4" so much I ordered the 7" to replace my It arrived sharp but I increased its sharpness with an oil stone then strop. You could now shave with it. EDIT: On my 7" I had no end of problems trying to get the tip sharp. I finally laid it against a flat edge and found it was bowed. When yours arrives, check it and if its bowed send it back.
customer_reviews.author: DJCTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp. Super flexible. Excellent filet knife. We used it the first time on a very challenging eel like fish and it was perfect. I’m impressed with the price and quality of this blade.
customer_reviews.author: ropeyz

customer_reviews.title: Still a great filet knife...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Rapala Filet Knives for many years, and always come back to them. This one arrived very dull. Sharpening a flexible filet knife on a whetstone isn’t too easy, but once the edge was razor sharp it’s easy to maintain. The manufacturer should at least send the knife with a good edge.
customer_reviews.author: Rado72

customer_reviews.title: Good blade shape. Needs constant sharpening. Dirt accumulates in the bolster.
customer_reviews.text: Blade shape is perfect for preparing fish, but it is not strong. Needs sharpening after cutting a few fish bones. You may use two knives, this one for filleting and another for bones, but it defeats the purpose. Bolster is made from a different material and there are gaps and a small void inside. All sort of things accumulate in those gaps and it is difficult to clean. It has worked well for over 30 days of fishing with daily use, but I am definitely looking for a replacement. Not unhappy with the knife considering the price, but would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Best fillet knife on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fillet knife I’ve used. I use it for all sizes of freshwater fish - northern, bass, walleye, crappie, bluegill. It’s perfectly flexible and dangerously sharp. It hold a sharp edge for several fish, and it’s easy to sharpen when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Doherty

customer_reviews.title: heirloom like quality. Gorgeous wood handle
customer_reviews.text: Flexible, heirloom like quality. Gorgeous wood handle. I used butchers block wax on the wood handle to preserve it. It came very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: XJfan

customer_reviews.title: disappointed, is this a fake
customer_reviews.text: The brass ring that holds blade in broke after one use. I am so disappointed in poor quality of this item. I really thought rapala was a good brand. I chose this over other items that looked better and were cheaper because of the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona person

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and perfect size for delicate filleting
customer_reviews.text: Got my knife today and used it on a few trout I caught this morning. Absolutely perfect size for cleaning trout and panfish. A few reviews said knife came dull, must have been a bad lot. This one came very sharp out of the box. Why have I been buying expensive fillet knives for small fish till now!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, but better value from other models
customer_reviews.text: This knife is nice looking, comes with a leather sheath and is easily packable in the 4” size. My biggest complaint is that I cannot get it sharp enough (or keep it sharp enough) to easily clean a stringer of fish. A couple fish at a time? Sure. Many at a time? Not quite. I also would not recommend it for a camp knife that gets used for lots of different purposes. Rapala makes a similar 4” model with a stainless blade and black handle that works quite a bit better. Ive been using these small knife types for years and prefer the Rapala stainless model over all.
customer_reviews.author: Tanna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: No matter how you try you will not get a sharp edge. No more stainless for me, give me the old carbon steel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Disanto

customer_reviews.title: Nice sheath - but the blade could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The knife itself is fine. Sheath is well made and the blade is coated with a non stick surface. What's not too love? It isn't really very sharp. I've had several Rapala knives that are wicked sharp when they arrive. This one, is just ok. I'll have to spend time working on it, or it will just sit in a drawer forever. My wife prefers a 20 year old filet knife that I've just about honed the blade to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blaize

customer_reviews.title: Rapala. Just keeps getting better and they're already excellent knives.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Rapala. Sharp out of the box. Excellent leather sheath. That's why I've used them for 40 years. Guess I'm very biased but they only keep getting better. Bought this one specifically for salt water use ( the coating). I did tape of the metal and spray the wood with a premium satin clear gloss. Looks great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Not like Rapala of old........
customer_reviews.text: Came with a bent blade tip (approximately 1" from the tip) and does not hold an edge like you come to expect from Rapala. Blade is a little too flexible for my tastes, but has its uses. Good luck acquiring and keeping an edge......steel is sub par for a knifeblade. Cannot recommend
customer_reviews.author: moamike

customer_reviews.title: Verry sharp.. Also has a nice sturdy handle.. Great to Filet fish & even skin a Deer..
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this for my boyfriend (one of his Valentine's Day gifts) He loves it. My boyfriend lives at the beach (Bethany Beach Delaware) so he's always out on his boat fishing, or in the woods hunting. it is verrry sharp, he has filet fish & skinned Deer & says it still sharp & loves it.. Loves it so much that he had asked for another 1 for xmas 😊buying him another
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Veasey

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: If you want a fancy looking knife - this won't make you happy. If you are like me, want a functional knife that actually works - this is the knife for you. Nothing fancy about it but it does work like intended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used to tip boat deckhands for filleting my fish. When they switched to making it a mandatory fee, I bought this to learn it myself and will never look back. It pays for itself on the first day. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great knife to replace a retired knife.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Normark knife for 30 years and it was time to replace. The blade was finally not holding an edge and the handle had seen better days, but that knife has probably cleaned up thousands of fish. This new knife is a perfect replacement. The handle feels great and grips well, the blade is very sharp and flexible. One key is the teflon coating on the knife which helps move is along. Will fit right in.
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: One sharp fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4" knife for filleting northern pike and getting the y bones out of the fillet. First time I used it I could not believe how sharp and quick it was for making fillets. Great little knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sharp and flexible
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite meat cutters knife. I use it to debone deer, and cut steak etc. It is very flexible and allows you to flex the blade around bone and / or following the contours of the bone structures to expertly separate meat from bone. OH it does well on smaller fish too.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Caruthers

customer_reviews.title: KNIFE IS BEAUTIFUL/CANT CUT ANYTHING THOUGH
customer_reviews.text: Knife is beautiful, but the blade is so dull I couldn't even cut a piece of paper. The knife is so nice that I just was going to keep it, but it is a bummer that I had to sharpen it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Drew

customer_reviews.title: Sheath too long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift, but very lightweight, well made, flexible fillet knife. Only complaint is that the sheath is absurdly large (knife only runs about half the length of the sheath)
customer_reviews.author: CBEN

customer_reviews.title: This fillet knie works wonders. The grip and angle ...
customer_reviews.text: This fillet knie works wonders. The grip and angle of the hint smoothly fits within my grip and I’ve had little problem filleting surfperch, calicos, halibut, and yellowtail.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Flexible & Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a secondary to the knife that my dad passed down to me. I was looking for one much more flexible than the fairly rigid one I have. My neighbor has a Rapala filet knife, similar to this one, and he raves about it. I haven’t used it yet, however after slicing right through a sheet of paper and being able to bend it about 45° on the counter, I’m convinced it’ll live up to its “super flex” name.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic scaling knife. Very durable, good design, and it holds an edge well. The blade does has some flex to it but it's because it's so long.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon White

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and expensive
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and expensive. You are paying for the brand... there are better options for half the price
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: like paper. Blade works great
customer_reviews.text: Sheath was cut the first time I out the knife into the sheath. The sheath is made extremely thin, like paper. Blade works great, no issues
customer_reviews.author: cselzer

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box sharp
customer_reviews.text: Got the 6 inch aiready have the 4. Inch. Arrived well packaged was sharp out of the clam pack, this 6 inch will be better for the walleyes, the 4 is great on yellow perch and crappie. Have used rapala blades for years and only had one that I could not keep sharp, a black soft handle model it's now used as a bait knife. Note I do have many other brands costing a lot more than the rapala blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my fiancé and it's a great cheap and sturdy knife. All other filet knives rusted within a few uses out on the saltwater but this one is still perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Product not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was such a disappointing filet knife! It was not sharp at all ....it came as though it needed to b sharpened! I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie Conrod

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Awesome fillet knife.
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered last night and it showed up today. Must warn you extremely sharp love it though that’s what you want. Very high quality blade and like it says super flexible. Great buy also!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Have had Rapalas in the past but this does not have near the quality of past ones. Blade is much too flexible and the finish on the blade not what I expected. Had a rough finish. Go to a store where you can view the knife before you buy. Very, very, unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Burnett

customer_reviews.title: DULL
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father in law. When he finally went to use it (was saving it for special fishing trip) it was so dull we could barely use it. Thought it would be of higher quality considering the reviews and that it is from Rapala.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It is OK.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. But blade gets dull fast. Also finish wearing off.
customer_reviews.author: s. grossinger

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp at all!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sucks not even sharp o pretty much went to thrift store to buy some worked better
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Nuno

customer_reviews.title: Too flexible vs my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this is perfect for some applications but there was actually too much flex in this for me to like it as my all around fillet knife. Only good for soft, skinned fish fillets
customer_reviews.author: Jen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife but was disappointed in the sharpness, had to sharpen it before taking it on wilderness trip.
customer_reviews.author: david baker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife for cleaning pan fish
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife for cleaning pan fish, grouse, and ducks. It has a nice edge on it right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: LH Texas

customer_reviews.title: on the fench
customer_reviews.text: While this is a good knife, I wish that it had a better edge to it when I bought it. I couldn't decide between the Rapala or the Bubba blade. I choose this one because the ratings were higher. I did take it to someone to sharpen for me and it was Great after that. Hence, the 4 stars. I'm sure that a person with sharpening skills will have no trouble with this knife at all.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: He loved it! He has one but it is over ...
customer_reviews.text: He loved it! He has one but it is over 30 years old and he wanted a new one so I found it!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Aycock

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Won’t hold an edge. Continually sharpening while filleting my catch.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Dulled after 30 perch fillets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an annual family perch fishing trip and was disappointed at how fast this blad dulled down.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not just for fisherman
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. A great fish fillet knife but I use it often to trim meat or to de-bone. If used just for work on meat, not hacking thru cartilage, certainly never on a vegetable, it may never need sharpening. Not just for fisherman. Every kitchen should have one.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan.RichVA

customer_reviews.title: Rapala 4" Fish n Fillet
customer_reviews.text: It's a Rapala ! Sharp, well made fillet knife is to be expected from Rapala. Fits well in the sheath and floats with the nice wooden handle. I've had the bigger 7" Rapala for many years with no complaints. I expect this small trout sized version will be excellent as well. Either one can be used to bone out big game as well as filleting fish.
customer_reviews.author: Desert DogTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Got it in time yesterday to trim up a buffalo tenderloin. Sharp. Well built and fits comfortably in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Chaapai

customer_reviews.title: You’ll need to put a much better edge on this knife!
customer_reviews.text: Terribly dull right out of the package. Compact and light weight. Handle will keep knife afloat if dropped in the water.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Good for most anything you want to slice.
customer_reviews.text: We use on fruits, vegetables as well as fish and all kinds of meats. Easy to sharpen. Have used for years!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: the perfect kitchen knife
customer_reviews.text: Like the larger Rapala knife, this little jewel is awesome. Small, easy to use and very sharp! Not to be used for cutting hard cheese or such since the blade is thin and flexible. Twisting would probably break it. That's not a complaint, just an observation. With a kitchen full of "good knives", this is the one I'm always reaching for...
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Get the 7"
customer_reviews.text: I've had the knife a few months. Works good but I previously had the 7.5" knife. Lost it and ordered the 6" thinking it was a 7".
customer_reviews.author: Go Broncos

customer_reviews.title: Nimble fillet knife-good blade
customer_reviews.text: One of the better fillet knives I've owned over the years. I use it for smaller pan fish and others that have pin bones that are tough to remove from the fillet. The blade has excellent flex to it and holds an edge well. Interested to see how the wooden handle holds up over time, as it is only stained and not sealed or polyurethened. Good knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: thank you.
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a great price, delivered on time, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those pan fish!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is our go to knife for cleaning fish. We clean alot of blue gills and perch. Easy to carry and store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for panfish or trout
customer_reviews.text: Love the blade coating and handle design. Easy to grip and flexible for skinning fish easily.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, I only use it for trimming meat ...
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, I only use it for trimming meat for the BBQ and I sharpen it regularly with my Work Sharp Knife & Tool Sharpener
customer_reviews.author: R. Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold an edge
customer_reviews.text: I like the knife and cover. easy to hold/handle. However, it does not hold an edge. When Filleting fish I had to resharpen often.
customer_reviews.author: SMilburn

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat Rapala knives.
customer_reviews.text: I love the flexibility of this knife. Can fillet bluegills or large bass with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Burch

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: Knife is really nice. I like the way it looks, the only issue is that when my wife used it for the first time a small piece of the handle chipped. I know it could have happened to any of them but it had to happen to the one I got for her. I would buy it again if the need arrises.
customer_reviews.author: Randy P.

customer_reviews.title: Worse knife ever
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice but is NOT sharp. cheaper fillet knives I have are sharper than this
customer_reviews.author: shamim

customer_reviews.title: and he said it was awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift to someone who fillets fish all the time, and he said it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dar-man

customer_reviews.title: Dull knife
customer_reviews.text: Not really to much to say about the disappointment in receiving a knife that cannot be use out of the box on delicate fish like trout. The knife just didn't have much of an edge. Could not recommend this knife to anglers out there..
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Morales

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Razor-sharp, holds edge well, easy to re-sharp, convenient to use
customer_reviews.author: Ya. SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: The best fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: I think this is about number 6 or 7 in the last 30 years. Great knife, I have cleaned thousands of fish with Rapala fillet knifes.We use them while camping and cooking also. when they are wore out I give it to my wife and we use it in the kitchen. Great for deboneing a whole ham and carveing a turkey. I wish they made all kinds of knifes, they are missing a ready made market. With all the guys that have their knifes .
customer_reviews.author: robert m. shawcross

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice knife, but the blade is not that sharp right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and usable
customer_reviews.text: Nice little travel knife for fishing outdoors not completely the best but good enough to take anywhere you need
customer_reviews.author: Alexander D Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled by the pretty gimmicks
customer_reviews.text: Cams out of the box with the dullest rapala blade I’ve ever encountered. Buy another model. Do t be fooled by the steak coated blade & textured handle.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Berry

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife. Seems to be made well. I havent used it yet but will update if I notice the quality going downhill. So far so good. Nice leather sheath, sturdy handle.
customer_reviews.author: shoprincess

customer_reviews.title: Good job Rapala
customer_reviews.text: Good looking knife nice leather sheath best I’ve seen from Rapala
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: I originally gave this knife 3 stars but things change!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a few times. Seams a little fragile but only time will tell. Edit: so I've had this knife for a while and I got lucky enough to harvest a deer this archery season. It's amazing how many times I reached for this knife over others.
customer_reviews.author: samoset

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality.... not as advertised.... blade not razor sharp, sheath is of cheap quality.... do not buy... not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mark L Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful knife.
customer_reviews.text: I buy these knives for presents when I am invited to someones house for a party or dinner. They make an elegant gift, extremely sharp, well made, easiest knife for cutting fruit and vegetables or any small food. People I give them to often photograph them and send the photos to their friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence W. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: My knife came with the tip bent. Meaning there is a tiny hook at the end of the blade. Really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kalanie Aholelei

customer_reviews.title: Great For "Close-In" Duties
customer_reviews.text: I started out with the 6-inch Superflex and now have, in addition to the 6", the 7.5 & 4" versions of this knife. The flex isn't excessive but does save my index finger some soreness after a long cleaning session.
customer_reviews.author: Ogy

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best fillet knife I'v ever owned. Blade is thin, sharp, and VERY flexible. I use mine for filleting panfish - bluegill, redear, and crappie, even the ocassional catfish and I have found NONE better. If you're a panfish fisherman, I recommend the 4" blade. If you go after bigger stuff, you mught want to look at the 6" version.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love this little knife!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little knife. It's easy to keep a sharp edge on it. It slices thru raw chicken or beef, like I'm cutting soft butter! I live on a sailboat and keep all my knives in a drawer. The leather sheath protects the knife and looks good at the same time. I recommend this product, but watch out, it's sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Recovering PackRat

customer_reviews.title: For my wife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, for processing small game. Stays sharp, great product.
customer_reviews.author: bryan fortner

customer_reviews.title: He loved it as soon as he saw it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a fishermen as a gift. He loved it as soon as he saw it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Rapala Fish & Filet Knife
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for someone who filets and sells fish. He loved the knife.
customer_reviews.author: The Bun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good knife for large fish and it's my favorite kitchen knife
customer_reviews.author: SKELATORN

customer_reviews.title: Best blade for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding edge and non-stick coating make filleting a quick and easy task. Flexible blade allows very precise cutting and de-skinning fillets. The leather sheath is a nice bonus as well. My favorite fillet knife of the many many I own.
customer_reviews.author: Skullhart

customer_reviews.title: The Skinny
customer_reviews.text: This is a fillet knife! Sharp as a razor and beautifully made of the finest stainless steel you can buy at this price point. Excellent for fishing and fits in the hand well. Comes with soft leather sheath that you can slide on to your belt.
customer_reviews.author: DBCooper

customer_reviews.title: VERY SHARP. perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love how sharp this filet knife is! Comes with protector case.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Nephew loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a birthday present for my nephew and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fish knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife feels great in your hand,it easily allows me to skin fish with no waste. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great steel, sharpen to a razors edge
customer_reviews.text: Have used these( fillet) knives for years in the kitchen, great steel, sharpen to a razors edge!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Garven

customer_reviews.title: he was pretty happy. Pretty sharp
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for someone, he was pretty happy. Pretty sharp. But lets see for how long.
customer_reviews.author: supp

customer_reviews.title: Retains Very Sharp Edge
customer_reviews.text: This knife stays very sharp for filleting many fish, even if cutting rib bones. Sharpest knife I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: jbscartog

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife for filleting my pan fish
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife for filleting my pan fish. It doesn't get the initial cut by the head going all of the time, but I have a serrated knife that will do that initial stroke. This is good for the more meticulous work! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JMorgs

customer_reviews.title: I have used Rapala fillet knives before. this one ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used Rapala fillet knives before. this one is well built, the blade is strong but flexible. I am looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use this knife MORE than any knife I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife MORE than any knife I have owned. My son uses this knife MORE than any knife he has owned. You will too! Remember though, this knife is a SuperFlex.
customer_reviews.author: The Ape @ApezAttic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great small size knife for trout streams, pan fish or other small game
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Breder

customer_reviews.title: ... any fish yet the knife is quite sharp and great quality. Warning will not help catch fish
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't caught any fish yet the knife is quite sharp and great quality. Warning will not help catch fish.....
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Fits the hand well.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Feels sharp and flexible. I haven't used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted for a gift to someone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and perfect flex for butterfly
customer_reviews.text: Sharp out of box and great filet knife. I butterfly salmon and flex is perfect. No more to be said.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Use mostly as pairing knife but also filet. Some what more flexable the standerd Rapalla knife but nonstick coating is great.
customer_reviews.author: Judy C.

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife very sharp out of the box nice flex
customer_reviews.author: Critters N Bugs

customer_reviews.title: He says this works wonderfully to fillet fish and I'm so happy he enjoys ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend as one of his birthday presents and he is obsessed with them! He says this works wonderfully to fillet fish and I'm so happy he enjoys it! The leather carrying pouch is so handy and keeps the knife covered and clean!
customer_reviews.author: kjb23

customer_reviews.title: A Christmas gift. I believe will be appreciated. ...
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift. I believe will be appreciated. Arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Houpt

customer_reviews.title: I like the knife
customer_reviews.text: I like the knife, but the black blade does not seem to get as sharp as the normal blades (or my 4" knife of the same brand).
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Love the leather case as well
customer_reviews.text: use this for more than just fish. Love the leather case as well.
customer_reviews.author: K G

product_meta.title: Rapala Fish n Fillet Superflex Knife
feature_bullets: Incredible extra thin blade allows the greatest flexibility and control ever.
PTFE non-stick coating lets fillets effortlessly fall away.
Razor-sharp handground stainless steel blade features through tang construction.
